intro: Anil benguellensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Anil benguellensis is also noted for its ability to thrive in humid environments with moderate temperatures.
